sentences: Tere tulemast! Ma ei taha unustada midagi täna.
Unusta see ja keskendu praegusele hetkele.
context: The Estonian word 'unustada' is a verb that means 'to forget'. It can be used in various contexts - forgetting something intentionally or unintentionally, neglecting to do something, or leaving something out. In the examples: 1) Forgetting an anniversary (unintentional memory lapse), 2) Not wanting to forget anything (deliberate remembering), and 3) Telling someone to forget something (deliberate act of forgetting). The verb can be conjugated in different tenses like 'unustasime' (we forgot - past tense) or used in imperative form like 'unusta' (forget! - command form).
